One movie that matches these preferences is "Flags of Our Fathers." This movie, directed by Francis Ford Coppola and based on the memoirs of five soldiers from the U.S. Marine Corps during World War II, tells the story of the five men who raised the famous American flag at Iwo Jima.

This movie is a powerful exploration of war, sacrifice, heroism, and the human condition.

Another movie that matches these preferences is "This Is Spinal Tap." This movie, directed by Martin Scorsese and based on the rockumentary film "The Movie," tells the story of the fictional rock band "Spinal Tap."

This movie is a hilarious exploration of the music industry, fame, celebrity culture, corporate greed, marketing, branding, product placement, advertising, and the human condition.

Another movie that matches these preferences is "A Farewell to Arms." This movie, directed by John Ford and based on the novel of the same name by Ernest Hemingway, tells the story of a group of American soldiers who are serving in Italy during World War II.
